sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: William of Malmesbury OSB, Gesta pontificum Anglorum. Adam of Eynsham OSB, Visio Eadmundi monachi de Egnesham
William of Malmesbury. Gesta Pontificum
msDesc.p: Vellum and paper, 340 210 13.4 x 8.2, ff. 1 + 64 + 56 + 24, double columns of 46 lines. Cent. xiv (and xvi), in pale ink. Blue initials with pretty red flourishing.
Collation: 1 flyleaf, 18-88 (wants 8, supplied in cent. xvi) | 56 leaves of paper follow of cent. xvi | 98-118.
Possibly from Norwich, see below: it may have been the property of Bale.

The contents show an interest in East Anglian matters. The look of the book, style of script and ornament incline me to suggest Norwich as its home. There is a xvth cent. note on the same page of payments. The MS. is mentioned as no. 17 in the Rolls edition. Parker and his secretaries have made many marginal notes.

msItem.head: William of Malmesbury OSB, Gesta pontificum Anglorum, books 1-4
Will. Malmesbury. Gesta Pontificum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber W. Malmesburiensis monachi de summis pontificibus liber primus
msItem.ab: The old hand ends in IV 186 (p. 326 Rolls Ed.)
f. 64r is a supply of cent. xvi on vellum

msItem.head: William of Malmesbury OSB, Gesta pontificum Anglorum, book 5
msItem.ab: Then follows the fifth book supplied on paper (28 lines to a page) by one of Parker's secretaries, ending 89
On the verso of the last is a note in Latin on the fabulosity of the next article

msItem.head: Adam of Eynsham OSB, Visio Eadmundi monachi de Egnesham
msItem.ab: Vision of the monk of Eynesham
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de uisione monachi Eneshamie. anno domini 1196
msItem.ab: (This rubric is later than the text, and the last three words are of cent. xvi)
The text is in a hand of the same character (possibly in the same hand) as no. 1
msItem.incipit: Quoniam notissimum habetur quod diem terris sole post tenebras
msItem.explicit: uirtus et magnificencia regnumque et imperium in secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.ab: It is the full text by Adam of Eynesham. See Ward, Catalogue of Romances II 493

msItem.head: William of Malmesbury OSB, Gesta regum Anglorum, book 1 (excerpts)
msItem.ab: On the following page in a hand of cent. xvi in double columns is an abridged extract from the Gesta Regum beginning
msItem.incipit: et profecto conceptum opus pietas explesset
msItem.explicit: post beatum Aldelmum et Bedam doctissimus
msItem.ab: At the top of this page in a hand of cent. xiv like that of the text is a note

ab.q:
Episcopi Estanglorum notantur fo. xxmo ixo sec. W. Malmsberi et de factis Herberti episcopi et de sedibus apud helmam et Theford.
Eliense monasterium post (?primo) constituit S. Etheldrida postea S. Athelwoldus Ep. monachos induxit folio 63
